title: Stage Datum
text:
The South Florida Water Management District (SFWMD) and agency partners is upgrading the reference system used to measure water elevation readings. SFWMD will shift from reporting water elevation readings in the National Geodetic Vertical Datum of 1929 (NGVD 29) to the North American Vertical Datum of 1988 (NAVD 88).
Below are values for waterbodies across the Greater Everglades Ecosystem.
RegionConversionValue (Feet) 1Lake Alligator1.00Lake Gentry1.10Lake Myrtle1.00Lake Hart1.10East Lake Tohopekaliga1.00Lake Tohopekaliga1.20Lake Cypress1.20Lake Hatchineha1.20Lake Kissimmee1.20Lake Istokpoga1.20Lake Okeechobee1.25WCA 11.50WCA 2A1.50WCA 3A1.50Rotenberger1.45Holey Land1.45St Lucie @ C23 C24 C251.50 1 NGVD29 to NAVD88 conversion value as reported by USACE and SFWMD

title: Stage Datum
text:
Conversion between datums

To convert to NAVD88
\[ NGVD29 - Conversion Factor = NAVD88 \]
For instance on 2007-01-16, gage height was reported as 8.63 ft NGVD29. The hypothetical conversion factor is 1.66. Therefore to convert to NAVD88 it would look like \(8.63\;ft\;\;NGVD29 - 1.66 = 6.97\;ft\;\;NAVD88\).


To convert to NAVD29
\[ NAVD88 + Conversion Factor = NGVD29 \]
For instance on 2007-01-16, gage height was reported as 10.22 ft NAVD88. The hypothetical conversion factor is 1.42. Therefore to convert to NGVD29 it would look like \(10.22\;ft\;\;NAVD88 + 1.42 = 11.64\;ft\;\;NGVD29\).
Additional information regarding datum conversions can be found at the USGS EDEN page.

title: Everglades System Conditions Report
text:
This webpage/report is intended to aggregate information from different agencies (i.e. USACE, SFWMD, FWC, USGS and NOAA) into one spot to help inform local government agencies and stakeholders on conditions within Lake Okeechobee, the Northern Estuaries and the Everglades ecosystem. The data provided here should be considered preliminary and are subject to change.




SFWMD: DBHYDRO
USGS: NWIS
USACE: SAJ Water Management
